Description: Fragment from shoulder of pottery oenochoe or amphora, somewhat worn. on shoulder, floral pattern with volutes and palmettes, thick black band below with added red band lined in white; part of one round and one square motif in frieze below. Pink clay with deep inclusion; white slip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by British School at Athens. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Kardara places this fragment in her 'mixed technique' style (193, 199-248) and for the attribution see 237-44. For the down-turned spiral see Petrie 1886, pl. 13 no. 2 and Gardner1888 pl.7 no. 5 (bowl) cf. Walter-Karydi 1973, 143 no. 895 (Berlin 2939 from Rhodes) and pl. 111 (shoulder ornament) and Boardman and Hayes 1966 no. 589 for bold black floral on a Rhodian amphora. For a Fikellura version see Venit 1988, no. 157 (Alexandria 9517). Gjerstad et al. 1977 pl. 14 no. 2 and 32-3 bears a similar design as decoration on the shoulder of an oinochoe; and see from Naukratis CVA Edinburgh 1 (16) pl.3 (1886.518.2e); CVA Reading 1 (12) pl. 22 nos. 14 (26.ii.44) and 15 (26.11.45), probably both oinochoai; CVA Oxford 2 (9) pl. 2.5-6 (G119.1) an oinochoe. Dehl-von Kaenel 1995 no.3430 an oinochoe fragment from Selinus is very close. T.J. Smith, "East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens", BSA 104, 2009, 349, fig. 6
Bibliographic references: Smith 2009 / East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens (p. 349, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.664)
